revision.comment: Needs the word gun to match the preceding "naval gun"
revision.text:
{{Infobox Weapon |name=15 cm SK L/40 |image=[[File:SMS Wolf 15 cm gun AWM P05338.179.jpg|300px]] |caption=A 15 cm SK L/40 gun aboard the German auxiliary cruiser [[SMS Wolf (auxiliary cruiser)|SMS ''Wolf'']] circa. 1916–18 |origin=German Empire |type=[[Naval gun]]
[[Coastal artillery|Coast-defence gun]] |is_ranged=y |is_explosive=yes |is_artillery=yes |service=1898—1945 |used_by=German Empire
Nazi Germany |wars=[[World War I]]
[[World War II]] |designer= |design_date=about 1896–98 |manufacturer= |production_date= |number= |variants= |weight=about {{convert|5000|kg|lb|sp=us}} |length=about {{convert|6|m|ftin|sp=us}} |part_length= |width= |height= |crew= |cartridge=Separate-loading, case charge |cartridge_weight={{convert|40|kg|sp=us}} |caliber={{convert|149.1|mm|in|sp=us}} |action= |rate= |velocity={{convert|800|m/s|ft/s|abbr=on}} |range= |max_range= |feed= |sights= |breech=horizontal sliding-block? |recoil= |carriage= |elevation= |traverse= }} The '''15 cm SK L/40'''SK - ''Schnelladekanone'' (quick loading cannon); ''L - Länge in Kaliber'' ([[Caliber#Caliber as measurement of length|length in caliber]]) was a [[Military of Germany|German]] [[naval gun]] that was used in [[World War I]] and [[World War II]]. ==Description== The 15 cm SK L/40 gun weighed about {{convert|5000|kg|sp=us}}, had an overall length of {{convert|6|m|ftin|sp=us}}. It used a horizontal sliding-block [[Breech-loading weapon|breech]]. ==See also== * [[List of naval guns]] * [[Battery Lothringen]] * [[15 cm L/40 Feldkanone i.R.]] * [[15 cm K (E)]] ===Weapons of comparable role, performance and era=== * [[QF 6 inch /40 naval gun]] British equivalent, firing slightly heavier shell ==Footnotes== ;Notes {{Reflist|group=Note}} ;Citations {{Reflist|colwidth=25em}} == References == * {{cite book|editor=Reichs-Marine-Amt|editor-link=Reichsmarineamt|title=Bedienungsvorschrift für die 15 cm Schnellade-Kanone L/40 in 15 cm Mittel-Pivot-Lafette C/97 in Einzelkasematte|publisher=E. S. Mittler|location=Berlin|year=1909|oclc=252061246}} * {{cite book|editor=Reichs-Marine-Amt|editor-link=Reichsmarineamt|title=Bedienungsvorschrift für die 15 cm Schnellade-Kanone L/40 Nr. 617,618 und 619 in 15 cm Minimalscharten-Lafette C/1902|publisher=E. S. Mittler|location=Berlin|year=1909|oclc=252061267}} * {{cite book|last=Campbell|first=John|title=Naval Weapons of World War Two|publisher=Conway Maritime Press|location=London|year=2002|isbn=0-87021-459-4}} * {{cite book|last=Gander|first=Terry|author2=Chamberlain, Peter|title=Weapons of the Third Reich: An Encyclopedic Survey of All Small Arms, Artillery and Special Weapons of the German Land Forces 1939–1945|publisher=Doubleday|location=New York|year=1979|isbn=0-385-15090-3}} * {{cite book|last=Hogg|first=Ian V.|authorlink=Ian V. Hogg|title=German Artillery of World War Two|publisher=Stackpole Books|location=Mechanicsville, PA|year=1997|edition=2nd corrected|isbn=1-85367-480-X}} * {{cite book| last = Rolf| first = Rudi| title = Der Atlantikwall: Bauten der deutschen Küstenbefestigungen 1940-1945| publisher = Biblio| year = 1998| location = Osnabrück| isbn = 3-7648-2469-7}} * {{cite book| last = Rolf| first = Rudi | title = A Dictionary on Modern Fortification: An Illustrated Lexicon on European Fortification in the Period 1800-1945| publisher = PRAK| year = 2004| location = Middleburg, Netherlands| isbn = }} ==External links== {{Commons category|15 cm SK L/40}} * [http://www.navweaps.com/Weapons/WNGER_59-40_skc96.htm 15 cm SK L/40 at Navweaps.com] {{DEFAULTSORT:15 Cm Sk L 40 Naval Gun}} [[Category:150 mm artillery]] [[Category:Naval guns of Germany]] {{artillery-stub}}
